official-title.#text: To reform the National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives September 10, 2013.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers Reform Act of 2013
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers Reform Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Reestablishment of the National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

text.#text: The

header.#text: Establishment of classes and categories of membership

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may establish separate classes of membership, with separate criteria, if the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: reasonably determines that performance of different duties requires different levels of education, training, experience, or other qualifications.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall establish a class of membership and membership criteria for business entities. A business entity that applies for membership shall be required to designate an individual
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: member responsible for the compliance of the business entity with
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: standards and the insurance laws, standards, and regulations of any State in which the business entity seeks to do business on the basis of
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: membership.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may establish separate categories of membership for insurance producers and for other persons or entities within each class, based on the types of licensing categories that exist under State laws.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

text.#text: The

header.#text: Separate categories for insurance producers permitted

text.#text: No special categories of membership, and no distinct membership criteria, shall be established for members that are depository institutions or for employees, agents, or affiliates of depository institutions.

header.#text: Separate treatment for depository institutions prohibited

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may establish criteria for membership which shall include standards for personal qualifications, education, training, and experience. The
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall not establish criteria that unfairly limit the ability of a small insurance producer to become a member of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , including imposing discriminatory membership fees.

authorize an insurance producer to sell, solicit, or negotiate insurance in any State for which the member pays the licensing fee set by the State for any line or lines of insurance specified in the home State license of the insurance producer, and exercise all such incidental powers as shall be necessary to carry out such activities, including claims adjustments and settlement to the extent permissible under the laws of the State, risk management, employee benefits advice, retirement planning, and any other insurance-related consulting activities;

text.#text: Membership in the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall establish, as a condition of membership, continuing education requirements which shall be comparable to the continuing education requirements under the licensing laws of a majority of the States.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

text.#text: The
A member may not be required to satisfy continuing education requirements imposed under the laws, regulations, provisions, or actions of any State other than the home State of the member.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall not require a member to satisfy continuing education requirements that are equivalent to any continuing education requirements of the home State of the member that have been satisfied by the member during the applicable licensing period.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

text.#text: State laws, regulations, provisions, or other actions purporting to regulate insurance producers shall be preempted to the extent provided in
No State shall—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

text.#text: impede the activities of, take any action against, or apply any provision of law or regulation arbitrarily or discriminatorily to, any insurance producer because that insurance producer or any affiliate plans to become, has applied to become, or is a member of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: that it pay fees different from those required to be paid to that State were it not a member of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ; or
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

text.#text: impose any requirement upon a member of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

text.#text: impose any continuing education requirements on any nonresident insurance producer that is a member of the

header.#text: States other than a home State

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , shall—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

text.#text: No State, other than the home State of a member of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: that is different from the criteria for membership in the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: or renewal of such membership;
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

text.#text: impose any licensing, personal or corporate qualifications, education, training, experience, residency, continuing education, or bonding requirement upon a member of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: that it be licensed, registered, or otherwise qualified to do business or remain in good standing in the State, including any requirement that the insurance producer register as a foreign company with the secretary of state or equivalent State official;
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

text.#text: impose any requirement upon a member of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: submit to a criminal history record check as a condition of doing business in the State; or
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

text.#text: require that a member of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , or require a member of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to be authorized to operate as an insurance producer, in order to sell, solicit, or negotiate insurance for commercial property and casualty risks to an insured with risks located in more than one State, if the member is licensed or otherwise authorized to operate in the State where the insured maintains its principal place of business and the contract of insurance insures risks located in that State.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

text.#text: impose any licensing, registration, or appointment requirements upon a member of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: as a result of a complaint or for any alleged activity, regardless of whether the activity occurred before or after the insurance producer commenced doing business in the State pursuant to
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: membership.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

text.#text: Nothing in this section may be construed to prohibit a State from investigating and taking appropriate disciplinary action, including suspension or revocation of authority of an insurance producer to do business in a State, in accordance with State law and that is not inconsistent with the provisions of this section, against a member of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall coordinate with the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority in order to ease any administrative burdens that fall on members of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: that are subject to regulation by the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority, consistent with the requirements of this subtitle and the Federal securities laws.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

header.#text: Coordination with Financial Industry Regulatory Authority

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , commence a civil action in an appropriate United States district court, and obtain all appropriate relief.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: of its bylaws and standards and this subtitle.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers
National Association of Registered Agents and Brokers

text.#text: The
For purposes of this subtitle, the following definitions shall apply:

term.#tail: means a corporation, association, partnership, limited liability company, limited liability partnership, or other legal entity.

text.#text: The term
The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 3 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Deposit Insurance Act/s:3

term.#tail: means the State in which the insurance producer maintains its principal place of residence or business and is licensed to act as an insurance producer.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means any product, other than title insurance or bail bonds, defined or regulated as insurance by the appropriate State insurance regulatory authority.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means any insurance agent or broker, excess or surplus lines broker or agent, insurance consultant, limited insurance representative, and any other individual or entity that sells, solicits, or negotiates policies of insurance or offers advice, counsel, opinions or services related to insurance.

text.#text: The term
The term

term.#tail: means the State in which an insurance producer maintains the headquarters of the insurance producer and, in the case of a business entity, where high-level officers of the entity direct, control, and coordinate the business activities of the business entity.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means the State in which an insurance producer resides for the greatest number of days during a calendar year.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: includes any State, the District of Columbia, any territory of the United States, and Puerto Rico, Guam, American Samoa, the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands, the Virgin Islands, and the Northern Mariana Islands.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: includes all laws, decisions, rules, regulations, or other State action having the effect of law, of any State.

text.#text: The term
A law of the United States applicable only to or within the District of Columbia shall be treated as a State law rather than a law of the United States.

header.#text: Laws applicable in the District of Columbia
